messages.message:
This is a great suggestion @Brian.
I discussed the general bug reporting process today in a meeting as well (before reading your post). And this fits into that topic super well.
Have you thought about how to build the Slack Bot yet?

Hi @Jasper! Thank you for the feedback :slightly_smiling_face:

We haven't explored the specifics around building the Slack Bot deeply, yet, but from initial research, we should be able to create a Slack app within a test channel and use the Slack API to configure said app to have read/write permissions to start.

There's a neat tutorial that could serve as a good starting point: https://api.slack.com/tutorials/tracks/create-bot-to-welcome-users
If it can't be automated w/o the use of commands, it could could be triggered by configuring a command (ex. `/screen [message here]`)

great idea!

for bug reports in <#C05BJCNKZAM|>, we can also ask for more info to help eng debug the issue (ex: a link to the page where you had an issue, re-create the issue in an internal org if the issue was reported in an external org, etc)
